result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antoine M. Brown

records.addlTxt:
11:00am Court in session

Defendant Antoine M. Brown appeared in court, in custody with Attorney Ashley L Renz. DDA Jim Sempf for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
Matter set before the Court is on sentencing. Deft pleads guilty to 2 misdemeanors in 20CF525 & guilty to felony bail jump in 20CF561.
Court reminds Deft of maximum penalties. 

PSI received & reviewed by the parties. No material corrections to be made by the parties. 
Court reminds Deft of firearm restriction & penalty if he violates & voting ineligibility. Deft acknowledges. 

State is in compliance with victims rights. Victim is present in court but does not wish to speak.
Atty Renz filed a letter yesterday, State has reviewed. 

State's argument & sentencing recommendation. 
Defense argument & sentencing recommendation. 

Deft makes statement to the Court & apologizes to victim. 

Court makes record & sentences Deft: 

20CF525
Ct #1
2 years 6 months WSP, Bifurcated
18 months IC
1 year ES
Consecutive to 20CF561

Ct #2
1 year Walworth County Jail without huber
Concurrent to Ct #1 20CF525

20CF561
Ct #1
2 years 6 months WSP, Bifurcated
18 months IC
1 year ES
Consecutive to 20CF561


Conditions of extended supervision to include: 

Payment of all costs, fees & surcharges. 
DNA Sample & Surcharge
Obtain/Maintain full-time employment, schooling or combination of both
No contact with victim unless necessary for family case purposes. 
No weapons including no ammunition
Absolute sobriety-No alcohol in the home, No purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol.
Not to enter into any bars, taverns or liquor stores. 
Not to possess or consume drugs or drug paraphernalia
Not to associate with any drug users or dealers. 
Counseling as recommended by the agent.
AODA & Comply
Anger Management counseling
Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent


Deft has 105 days jail credit
Deft is not eligible for CIP but is eligible for SAP

11:40am Court in recess

Defendant Antoine M. Brown appeared with atty Ashley Renz. Samuel Thomas Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case dismissed and read in. Minutes filed.  Further proceedings scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Antoine M. Brown in court with attorney Ashley L Renz.  Samuel Thomas Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deft understands charges & maximum penalties, preliminary hearing requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
